edu.stanford.math.plex4.metric.landmark
Class LandmarkSelector<T>

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.math.plex4.metric.landmark.LandmarkSelector<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the underlying type of the metric space
All Implemented Interfaces:
AbstractIntMetricSpace, AbstractObjectMetric<T>, AbstractObjectMetricSpace<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExplicitLandmarkSelector, MaxMinLandmarkSelector, RandomLandmarkSelector
public abstract class LandmarkSelector<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements AbstractObjectMetricSpace<T>

This abstract class defines the functionality of a landmark set within an arbitrary finite metric space. A landmark set is used as an approximation to the whole metric space for efficiency purposes. It also tends to denoise the dataset under investigation. For further information about landmark sets, please consult the paper "Topological estimation using witness complexes", by Vin de Silva and Gunnar Carlsson.

A class that derives from LandmarkSelector must implement the computeLandmarkSet function which implements the computation of the landmark set.

Author:
Andrew Tausz

getUnderlyingMetricSpace

public AbstractSearchableMetricSpace<T> getUnderlyingMetricSpace()

computeLandmarkSet

protected abstract int[] computeLandmarkSet()
This function constructs the set of landmark points. It must return an array of size landmarkSetSize, which contains the indices of the landmark points within the metric space.

Returns:
an array of indices corresponding to the landmark points in the metric space

getPoints

public T[] getPoints()
Description copied from interface: AbstractObjectMetricSpace
This function returns the set of points in the metric space as an array. The returned array satisfies the requirement that the indices of the points in the array are equal to the indices of the points within the metric space.

Specified by:
getPoints in interface AbstractObjectMetricSpace<T>
Returns:
an array containing the points of the metric space
